intro: Hedyotis saxatilis, commonly known as the rocky pennywort, is a small herbaceous plant native to rocky and mountainous regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in crevices and on rocky substrates, exhibiting a compact growth habit. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, while its small white flowers appear in clusters. Hedyotis saxatilis is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, nutrient-poor environments.
